body.p: A study examined how the percentage of participants who completed a survey is related to the monetary incentive that researchers promised to participants. Consider the relationship between these two quantitative variables, displayed in the scatterplot below.

The direction of this relationship is . In the context of this example, this means that when researchers promised higher payments, the percentage of participants who completed the survey . The form of the relationship is . Based on the form of the relationship as it is illustrated above, the relationship is quite .

response.name: positive
response.feedback: Correct. As the incentive amount increases, the percentage of returned surveys also tends to increase, indicating a positive relationship.

response.name: negative
response.feedback: Incorrect. A negative relationship means that when the values of one variable increase, the values of the other variable decrease. That is not what is happening in this scatterplot.

response.name: neither positive nor negative
response.feedback: Incorrect. When no relationship exists (neither positive nor negative), there is no clear pattern in the scatterplot. There is a pattern in this scatterplot, so a relationship does exist.

part.hint: A positive relationship means that when the values of one variable increase, so do the values of the other variable.

response.name: increased
response.feedback: Correct. Since a positive relationship exists, when the values of one variable increase, so do the values of the other variable.

response.name: remained the same
response.feedback: Incorrect. The percentage of participants who completed the survey would have decreased if no relationship exists. This scatterplot shows a positive relationship.

response.name: decreased
response.feedback: Incorrect. The percentage of participants who completed the survey would have decreased if a negative relationship exists. This scatterplot shows a positive relationship.

part.hint: A positive relationship means that when the values of one variable increase, so do the values of the other variable.

response.name: linear
response.feedback: Incorrect. Relationships with a linear form have points scattered about a straight line, but in this scatterplot, the points appear to curve at higher incentive amounts.

response.name: curvilinear
response.feedback: Correct. Relationships with a curvilinear form have points dispersed around a curved line, which appears to happen in this scatterplot at the higher incentive amounts.

response.name: neither linear nor curvilinear
response.feedback: Incorrect. When the scatterplot shows no clear pattern, the form of the relationship would be neither linear nor curvilinear. There is a clear pattern in the data in this scatterplot.

part.hint: Relationships with a linear form have points scattered about a straight line, while relationships with a curvilinear form have points dispersed around a curved line.

response.name: strong
response.feedback: Correct. The data points fit tightly into a curvilinear form.

response.name: weak
response.feedback: Incorrect. Note how closely the data points follow the suggested form.

part.hint: Do the data points fall tightly into a pattern, or is there a lot of scatter in the data?
